name: jetstream
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing jetstream cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`jetstream` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/Triple-Whale/terraform-provider-jetstream).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing jetstream cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/Triple-Whale/terraform-provider-jetstream)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-jetstream` repo](https://github.com/Triple-Whale/pulumi-jetstream/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-jetstream` repo](https://github.com/Triple-Whale/terraform-provider-jetstream/issues).

python.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/Triple-Whale/terraform-provider-jetstream)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-jetstream` repo](https://github.com/Triple-Whale/pulumi-jetstream/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-jetstream` repo](https://github.com/Triple-Whale/terraform-provider-jetstream/issues).

credentialData.description: The contents of the NATS 2.0 Credentials file to use

credentials.description: Path to the NATS 2.0 credentials file to use for authentication

nkey.description: Connect using a NKEY seed stored in a file

servers.description: Comma separated list of NATS servers to connect to

user.description: Connect using an username, used as token when no password is given

caFile.description: Path to the server root CA file (in PEM format). Needed when the NATS server has TLS enabled with an unknown root CA

caFileData.description: The root CA (file) content, in PEM format. Needed when the NATS server has TLS enabled with an unknown root CA

certFile.description: Path to client cert file (in PEM format). Needed when NATS server is configured to verify client certificate

certFileData.description: The cert file content (in PEM format). Needed when NATS server is configured to verify client certificate

keyFile.description: Path to client key file (in PEM format). Needed when NATS server is configured to verify client certificate

keyFileData.description: The key file content (in PEM format). Needed when NATS server is configured to verify client certificate

caFile.description: Path to the server root CA file (in PEM format). Needed when the NATS server has TLS enabled with an unknown root CA

caFileData.description: The root CA (file) content, in PEM format. Needed when the NATS server has TLS enabled with an unknown root CA

certFile.description: Path to client cert file (in PEM format). Needed when NATS server is configured to verify client certificate

certFileData.description: The cert file content (in PEM format). Needed when NATS server is configured to verify client certificate

keyFile.description: Path to client key file (in PEM format). Needed when NATS server is configured to verify client certificate

keyFileData.description: The key file content (in PEM format). Needed when NATS server is configured to verify client certificate

filterSubject.description: Only copy messages matching a specific subject, not usable for mirrors

name.description: The name of the source Stream

startSeq.description: The sequence to start mirroring from

startTime.description: The time stamp in the source stream to start from, in RFC3339 format

subjectTransforms.description: The subject filtering sources and associated destination transforms

api.description: The subject prefix for the remote API

deliver.description: The subject prefix where messages will be delivered to

filterSubject.description: Only copy messages matching a specific subject, not usable for mirrors

startSeq.description: The sequence to start mirroring from

startTime.description: The time stamp in the source stream to start from, in RFC3339 format

deliver.description: The subject prefix where messages will be delivered to

provider.description:
The provider type for the jetstream package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

credentials.description: Path to the NATS 2.0 credentials file to use for authentication

nkey.description: Connect using a NKEY seed stored in a file

servers.description: Comma separated list of NATS servers to connect to

user.description: Connect using an username, used as token when no password is given

credentials.description: Path to the NATS 2.0 credentials file to use for authentication

nkey.description: Connect using a NKEY seed stored in a file

servers.description: Comma separated list of NATS servers to connect to

user.description: Connect using an username, used as token when no password is given

ackPolicy.description: The delivery acknowledgement policy to apply to the Consumer

ackWait.description: Number of seconds to wait for acknowledgement

backoffs.description: List of durations in Go format that represents a retry time scale for NaK'd messages. A list of durations in seconds.

deliverAll.description: Starts at the first available message in the Stream

deliverLast.description: Starts at the latest available message in the Stream

deliverLastPerSubject.description: Starts with the last message for each subject matched by filter

deliverNew.description: Starts with the next available message in the Stream

deliveryGroup.description: When set Push consumers will only deliver messages to subscriptions with this group set

deliverySubject.description: The subject where a Push-based consumer will deliver messages

description.description: Contains additional information about this consumer

durableName.description: The durable name of the Consumer

filterSubject.description: Only receive a subset of messages from the Stream based on the subject they entered the Stream on

filterSubjects.description:
Only receive a subset of messages from the stream baseed on the subjects they entered the Streeam on, exlusive to
filter_subject and works with nats-server v2.10 or better

flowControl.description: Enable flow control for push consumers

headersOnly.description: When true no message bodies will be delivered only headers

heartbeat.description: Enable heartbeat messages for push consumers, duration specified in seconds

inactiveThreshold.description: Removes the consumer after a idle period, specified as a duration in seconds

maxAckPending.description: Maximum pending Acks before consumers are paused

maxBatch.description: Limits Pull Batch sizes to this maximum

maxBytes.description: The maximum bytes value that maybe set when dong a pull on a Pull Consumer

maxDelivery.description: Maximum deliveries to attempt for each message

maxExpires.description: Limits the Pull Expires duration to this maximum in seconds

maxWaiting.description: The number of pulls that can be outstanding on a pull consumer, pulls received after this is reached are ignored

memory.description: Force the consumer state to be kept in memory rather than inherit the setting from the stream

metadata.description: Free form metadata about the consumer

ratelimit.description: The rate limit for delivering messages to push consumers, expressed in bits per second

replayPolicy.description: The rate at which messages will be replayed from the stream

replicas.description: How many replicas of the data to keep in a clustered environment

sampleFreq.description: The percentage of acknowledgements that will be sampled for observability purposes

startTime.description: The timestamp of the first message that will be delivered by this Consumer

streamId.description: The name of the Stream that this consumer consumes

streamSequence.description: The Stream Sequence that will be the first message delivered by this Consumer

ackWait.description: Number of seconds to wait for acknowledgement

description.description: Contains additional information about this bucket

history.description: How many historical values to keep

maxBucketSize.description: Maximum size of the entire bucket

placementCluster.description: Place the bucket in a specific cluster, influenced by placement_tags

placementTags.description: Place the stream only on servers with these tags

replicas.description: Number of cluster replicas to store

ttl.description: How many seconds a value will be kept in the bucket

ack.description: If the Stream should support confirming receiving messages via acknowledgements

allowDirect.description: Allow higher performance, direct access to get individual messages via the $JS.DS.GET API

allowRollupHdrs.description:
Allows the use of the Nats-Rollup header to replace all contents of a stream, or subject in a stream, with a single new
message

compression.description: Optional compression algorithm used for the Stream

denyDelete.description: Restricts the ability to delete messages from a stream via the API. Cannot be changed once set to true

denyPurge.description: Restricts the ability to purge messages from a stream via the API. Cannot be change once set to true

description.description: Contains additional information about this stream

discard.description: When a Stream reach it's limits either old messages are deleted or new ones are denied

discardNewPerSubject.description:
When discard policy is new and the stream is one with max messages per subject set, this will apply the new behavior to
every subject. Essentially turning discard new from maximum number of subjects into maximum number of messages in a
subject

duplicateWindow.description: The size of the duplicate tracking windows, duration specified in seconds

maxAge.description: The maximum oldest message that can be kept in the stream, duration specified in seconds

maxBytes.description: The maximum size of all messages that can be kept in the stream

maxConsumers.description: Number of consumers this stream allows

maxMsgSize.description: The maximum individual message size that the stream will accept

maxMsgs.description: The maximum amount of messages that can be kept in the stream

maxMsgsPerSubject.description: The maximum amount of messages that can be kept in the stream on a per-subject basis

metadata.description: Free form metadata about the stream

mirror.description: Specifies a remote stream to mirror into this one

placementCluster.description: Place the stream in a specific cluster, influenced by placement_tags

placementTags.description: Place the stream only on servers with these tags

replicas.description: How many replicas of the data to keep in a clustered environment

republishDestination.description: The destination to publish messages to

republishHeadersOnly.description: Republish only message headers, no bodies

retention.description: The retention policy to apply over and above max_msgs, max_bytes and max_age

sources.description: Specifies a list of streams to source into this one

storage.description: The storage engine to use to back the stream

subjectTransform.description: Subject transform to apply to matching messages

subjects.description: The list of subjects that will be consumed by the Stream, may be empty when sources and mirrors are present
